channel.title: [317][PI] Auto Announcement [/PI][/317]
channel.description:
Here's what I did. (DEMOLISHSCAPE V8 BASE, 317, PI)
[quote="Uncalled, post:1, topic:365303"][center][shadow=red,left][size=18pt][u][b]Repeating Message Code[/b][/u][/size][/shadow][/center] Okay, for this one, open up your client.java and add this void:
[code=java] public void mymessage() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { sendMessage("[@red@SERVER NOTICE@bla@]: Your server message here"); } }, 100000); //Time it takes to send the message }; [/code] This is what your message will look like when it shows it to the players. The time it takes to send the message is counted down in milliseconds. And every computer comes with a calculator and there's 1000 milliseconds in 1 second so you do the math. So you can edit '}, 100000); //Time it takes to send the message' that to change how long it takes for the message to be sent. The 'public void execute(EventContainer c) {' will make it so it'll be a public message. Every PI source has the EventContainer in it, unless it was removed by the uploader.
And after you add that code, find [code=java] public void initialize() { [/code] And under that add: [code=java] mymessage(); [/code] This will initialize the message. So in other words, the thing that will make it work.
And you're done![/quote]
The Error: client.java:26: cannot find symbol symbol : class Event location: class client EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { ^ client.java:26: cannot find symbol symbol : variable EventManager location: class client EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Files Compiled Successfully!

@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Zerk P0wer, post:14, topic:387563”]You should add this and delete your old server random message:

public void mymessage() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { sendMessage("<col=fff0000>[Server]</col>: <shad=39456421>*MESSAGE HERE*"); } }, 700000); // Time it takes to send the message };

Idk if it is allowed to post in a topic thats not used in 120 days, but i AM sure to reply
Reason being because this person is NOT helped and i do like to help him…

If you want to mute / ban me moderators do your work.

Zerk P0wer.[/quote]
3 months…had to google calendar.

item.title: [317][PI] Auto Announcement [/PI][/317]
item.dc:creator: @Saletana Saletana
item.description:
@Saletana wrote:

Here’s what I did. (DEMOLISHSCAPE V8 BASE, 317, PI)

[quote=“Uncalled, post:1, topic:365303”][center][shadow=red,left][size=18pt]Repeating Message Code[/size][/shadow][/center]
Okay, for this one, open up your client.java and add this void:

public void mymessage() {
        EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
            public void execute(EventContainer c) {
                sendMessage("[@red@SERVER NOTICE@bla@]: Your server message here");
            }
        }, 100000); //Time it takes to send the message 
    };

This is what your message will look like when it shows it to the players.
The time it takes to send the message is counted down in milliseconds.
And every computer comes with a calculator and there’s 1000 milliseconds in 1 second so you do the math.
So you can edit ‘}, 100000); //Time it takes to send the message’ that to change how long it takes for the message to be sent.
The ‘public void execute(EventContainer c) {’ will make it so it’ll be a public message. Every PI source has the EventContainer in it, unless it was removed by the uploader.

And after you add that code, find

public void initialize() {
And under that add:

mymessage();
This will initialize the message.
So in other words, the thing that will make it work.

And you’re done![/quote]

The Error:
client.java:26: cannot find symbol
symbol : class Event
location: class client
EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
^
client.java:26: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable EventManager
location: class client
EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!

Read full topic
